japanesTitle: 第三回戦！ぐるぐるローラーレース！
description: The third round of the Davy Back Fight begins as the Straw Hats and Foxy Pirates compete in a roller race around a giant circular track. With Chopper's fate still hanging in the balance, Luffy faces his greatest challenge yet: learning to roller skate while racing against the cunning Foxy Pirates.
usReleaseNote: Simulcast: August 4, 2012; DVD: August 7, 2012; Toonami: June 29, 2013

events.title: Round 3 Roller Race Begins
events.description: The third round of the Davy Back Fight officially begins. The Roller Race is announced as a circular track competition where teams race on roller skates across five rounds, with the first team to win three rounds claiming victory and the prize.
events.significance: This establishes the stakes for the episode - the Straw Hats must win to recover Chopper who was lost in an earlier round. The race format introduces a new challenge that tests the crew's adaptability and teamwork.

events.title: Luffy Cannot Roller Skate
events.description: Luffy's complete inability to roller skate is revealed as a major obstacle for the Straw Hats. Despite his incredible strength and agility in combat, Luffy repeatedly falls and struggles to even stand on skates, creating a comedic yet challenging situation for the team.
events.significance: This moment showcases a rare instance where Luffy's physical capabilities fail him in a non-combat scenario. It demonstrates that raw strength doesn't always translate to every situation, and highlights the importance of teamwork and creative problem-solving.

quotes.text: I can't stand up! These things are impossible!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy struggling with roller skates before the race

events.title: Foxy Devils Team Debut
events.description: The Foxy Pirates' specialized roller racing team, the Foxy Devils, is introduced. The team consists of Chiqicheetah (a cheetah-themed speedster), Mashikaku, Jube, and Girarin, all specially selected for their skating abilities and tactics.
events.significance: This anime-original team demonstrates Foxy's strategic approach to the Davy Back Fight, having specialized teams for different events. It establishes the competitive threat the Straw Hats face in this round.

events.title: Robin's Creative Solution for Luffy
events.description: Facing the problem of Luffy's inability to skate, Nico Robin devises a creative solution using her Hana Hana no Mi powers. She uses her abilities to physically roll Luffy around the track, compensating for his lack of skating skills while maintaining his speed as the point runner.
events.significance: This demonstrates Robin's problem-solving abilities and tactical thinking. It showcases how the Straw Hats work together to overcome individual weaknesses, and proves that unconventional solutions can be effective in competition.

quotes.text: Don't worry, Captain. I'll help you around the track.
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin offering to help Luffy complete the race

events.title: Nami and Usopp's Psychological Tactics
events.description: Nami and Usopp attempt to exploit Foxy's massive ego through strategic insults and compliments, trying to distract him and throw off his concentration during the race. They alternate between mocking and flattering Foxy to keep him off-balance.
events.significance: This showcases Nami and Usopp's cunning and understanding of their opponent's personality. While physical strength isn't their forte, they use psychological warfare as their weapon, demonstrating the diverse skill sets within the Straw Hat crew.

events.title: Foxy Uses Noro Noro Beam in Race
events.description: Foxy deploys his signature Noro Noro Beam (Slow-Slow Beam) during the race, attempting to slow down the Straw Hat racers. The beam temporarily slows down anything it hits for thirty seconds, giving the Foxy Pirates a significant advantage in the competition.
events.significance: This demonstrates Foxy's willingness to use his Devil Fruit powers in what should be a fair competition, showcasing his deceptive and underhanded tactics. It also reminds viewers of the thirty-second time limit of the beam's effect, which becomes important strategically.

quotes.text: Feh feh feh! Take this! Noro Noro Beam!
quotes.speaker: Foxy
quotes.context: Foxy using his Devil Fruit power during the race

events.title: Robin's Strategic Counter to Noro Noro Beam
events.description: Robin devises a brilliant counter-strategy to Foxy's Noro Noro Beam. Understanding the beam's thirty-second duration limit, she deliberately takes Luffy off the track course when hit by the beam, then returns after the effect wears off. Additionally, she uses her powers to hold Foxy's hands apart, preventing him from forming the beam gesture.
events.significance: This showcases Robin's analytical intelligence and strategic thinking. By understanding the mechanics and limitations of Foxy's Devil Fruit power, she turns his advantage into a manageable obstacle. Her physical interference also demonstrates creative combat applications of the Hana Hana no Mi.

events.title: Zoro and Sanji's Unexpected Cooperation
events.description: Despite their usual rivalry and constant bickering, Zoro and Sanji work together effectively as support team members. Sanji uses his culinary knowledge to identify ingredients that help defeat Chiqicheetah, while Zoro retrieves a long kiwi fruit at the critical moment.
events.significance: This rare moment of cooperation between the crew's two strongest fighters demonstrates that despite their surface-level conflicts, they can work together when it matters. It shows the underlying bond and trust within the Straw Hat crew.

quotes.text: I can't stand up! These things are impossible!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy

quotes.text: Don't worry, Captain. I'll help you around the track.
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin

quotes.text: Feh feh feh! Take this! Noro Noro Beam!
quotes.speaker: Foxy
quotes.context: Foxy using his Devil Fruit power during the race

themes.description: The episode emphasizes how the Straw Hats overcome individual weaknesses through teamwork and creative problem-solving. Luffy's inability to skate becomes irrelevant when Robin helps him, demonstrating that a crew's strength comes from supporting each other.
themes.symbolism: The roller race serves as a metaphor for the journey ahead - success requires not just individual strength but collective effort and creative thinking.

themes.description: Robin's strategic thinking and understanding of Foxy's Devil Fruit limitations proves more valuable than raw physical power. The episode shows that analyzing opponents and exploiting their weaknesses is as important as direct combat ability.
themes.symbolism: The thirty-second time limit of the Noro Noro Beam represents how every advantage has limitations that can be exploited through careful observation and planning.

themes.description: The Straw Hats face significant disadvantages - Luffy can't skate, they're competing against specialists, and Foxy cheats with his Devil Fruit - yet they persist and find ways to compete. This reinforces the series' theme of never giving up.
themes.symbolism: Luffy being rolled around the track rather than skating traditionally symbolizes that unconventional approaches can be just as effective as conventional ones.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's inability to roller skate provides both comedy and challenge. Despite being the crew's strongest fighter, he must rely completely on Robin's help, showing his willingness to trust his crewmates and accept help when needed.
keyActions: Relies on Robin to move around the track
Serves as the point runner despite his inability to skate
quotes: I can't stand up! These things are impossible!

characterSpotlights.development: Robin demonstrates her analytical intelligence and tactical prowess. She solves the Luffy skating problem creatively, analyzes Foxy's Devil Fruit limitations, and implements counter-strategies effectively.
keyActions: Devises solution to help Luffy race without skating
Analyzes the thirty-second duration of Noro Noro Beam
Uses her powers to prevent Foxy from using his beam
Strategically exits and re-enters the course
quotes: Don't worry, Captain. I'll help you around the track.

characterSpotlights.development: Foxy's deceptive nature is on full display as he uses his Devil Fruit powers to cheat in the competition. His massive ego makes him vulnerable to psychological manipulation by Nami and Usopp.
keyActions: Uses Noro Noro Beam to slow Straw Hat racers
Leads the Foxy Devils racing team
Falls for Nami and Usopp's psychological tactics
quotes: Feh feh feh! Take this! Noro Noro Beam!

characterSpotlights.development: Nami shows her cunning by attempting to manipulate Foxy through his ego, demonstrating her understanding of human psychology and her willingness to use any advantage available.
keyActions: Works with Usopp to distract opponents
Participates as a racer in the competition

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp uses his understanding of opponents' personalities to create openings for his team, showing that his value extends beyond his marksmanship.
keyActions: Teams up with Nami for psychological tactics
Alternates insults and compliments to confuse Foxy

mangaDifferences.difference: Episode 213 and the entire Roller Race event is anime-original filler content. In the manga, the Davy Back Fight consists of only three rounds total, and this roller race does not exist.
The anime extended the Davy Back Fight from three rounds (manga) to six rounds, with Luffy agreeing to a second set of three rounds. The roller race is part of this anime-only extension.
Characters Chiqicheetah, Mashikaku, Jube, and Girarin are anime-only characters created for the Foxy Devils roller racing team and do not appear in the manga.

trivia.fact: Episode 213 achieved an 11.4% TV rating in Japan, ranking 7th among One Piece episodes at the time, showing strong viewership despite being filler content.
This episode is part of the first One Piece episodes to be broadcast in 16:9 widescreen format, starting with Episode 207 at the beginning of the Long Ring Long Land Arc.

The roller race is entirely anime-original content. The manga's Davy Back Fight only had three rounds, but the anime extended it to six rounds, with the roller race being one of the additional rounds.

sources.title: Long Ring Long Land Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode's eyecatcher featured Luffy, appropriately highlighting the main character's comedic struggle with roller skating that drives much of the episode's humor.
The Long Ring Long Land Arc is often cited as one of the most divisive arcs among fans, with the anime-original episodes like this one contributing to mixed reception due to pacing concerns.

sources.title: One Piece's Most Hated Story Was Actually Ruined By The Anime
